Sullivan/Getty Images) Google Inc. cofounder Larry Page is taking over as chief executive officer of the Internet company, after current CEO Eric Schmidt leaves the post he has held for more than a decade on April 4. As Google Inc. has grown, managing the business has become more complicated.... Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google Inc. 's chief executive officer, according to Eric Schmidt in a Google Inc. Blog. The Daily Caller reports Rep. Mike Pence ( R-IN), a possible contender for president in 2012, has announced that he will NOT run for the White House: As reported by the Indianapolis Star, Mike Pence has circulated a letter to supporters announcing the decision. `` In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana,'' wrote Mike Pence .`` We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.''
